Undergraduate
=============

Faculty of Civil Engineering
============================

### The Bachelor of Engineering (Civil) is offered either on a full-time or part-time basis. The full-time programme is the main programme, offered by the Faculty of Civil Engineering while the part-time programme is offered by the School of Professional and Continuing Education (SPACE). The full-time programme is offered only at the UTM Main Campus in Skudai while the part-time programme is offered at various centres throughout Malaysia. The duration of study for the full-time programme is subjected to the student’s entry qualifications and lasts between four (4) years to a maximum of six (6) years.

 What Is
========

Civil Engineering ?  

----------------------

Civil engineering is a broad discipline that encompasses studies on structures and the natural resources such as water, soil and the environment. It is also considered as an important technological discipline towards the betterment of mankind.

The faculty offers an undergraduate programme which is recognised by the Malaysian Qualifications Agency (MQA). The undergraduate programme is implemented to encompass three (3) thrust areas, which are :-

##### Structures and Materials

Civil engineering materials, mechanics of materials, dynamics and static, theory and design of structures and buildings, contract and estimation, principles an practices of construction and management.

##### Geotechnic & Transportation

Soil mechanics, foundation engineering and materials, geology, highway design and planning, traffic and transportation.

##### Hydraulics,Hydrology & Environmental

Fluid mechanics and designs of surface and underground water resources system, dams, sewerage systems, water reticulation & drainage and irrigation, offshore, port and hydraulic structures.

Monitoring and control of environmental qualities, drinking water, waste water, disposal and solid wastes, thus, ensuring the natural resources is utilised in a manner that guarantees the well being of mankind and environmental stability.

Our Head of Departments
-----------------------

Our faculty is comprised of three primary departments, each dedicated to excellence in teaching, research, and service. These departments work closely together to provide a comprehensive and interdisciplinary educational experience, fostering innovation and academic growth

![](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

###### 01

### Department Structures and Materials

The Department of Structures and Materials specializes in the research and development of cutting-edge materials, structural design, and construction techniques, contributing to advancements in engineering and sustainable infrastructure

![](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

###### 02

### Department Geotechnics and Transportation

The Department of Geotechnics and Transportation focuses on the study and application of soil mechanics, foundation engineering, and transportation systems to advance infrastructure development and transportation efficiency

![](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

###### 03

### Department Water and Environmental Engineering

The Department of Water and Environmental Engineering focuses on sustainable water management, environmental conservation, and ecological engineering to address global challenges
